modules.description: This module provides low-level TLS connection management over Unix file descriptors or channels, including handshake initiation, I/O operations, session shutdown, and renegotiation. It works with TLS configurations, sockets, and channels for secure communication. Concrete use cases include implementing custom TLS servers or clients with precise control over connection lifecycle and security parameters.

This module loads and authenticates X.509 certificates using Lwt for asynchronous I/O. It reads PEM-encoded certificate chains and private keys from files, and builds certificate authenticators based on trusted CAs, fingerprints, or CRLs. It directly handles `X509.Certificate.t` lists and `X509.Authenticator.t` values for TLS configuration and validation.

This module provides Lwt-based TLS communication over network sockets with functions to accept and connect TLS-secured channels. It works with input and output channels, file descriptors, and TLS configurations for secure client-server interactions. Concrete use cases include building asynchronous TLS servers that accept and handle secure connections, and implementing TLS clients that connect to remote services with custom or default security settings.
